title: I like how you all use the win rate/pick rate argument with Vayne, but when we start talking Ahri...
body: It's suddenly a different situation and the argument is null and void. Consistency pls.

replies.body:
<--- ahri main. yes ahri is in fact too good right now....

its not her power, its her reliability. charm/ult available too often.


vayne is OP because she has mobility on a 2 second CD (which also resets her AA), a targeted stun (which is available so long as you aren't aiming right down the lane, you seriously cant miss if you aim perpendicular in relation to the lanes) and a passive which says you either have an escape mechanism or you're forced to 1v1. 

so congrats you're forced to fight a carry with a stun! and she has lifesteal/stun/max %health true damage! and because all the AD items are pretty even across the board, it doesn't really matter how much raw AD she lacks because her AS/Crit make up for it to even out. compared with other ADC's against vayne, it JUST SO HAPPENS, to have utility as an ADC.

basically vayne gets to choose when she fights, and her %health makes it so it doesn't matter what you build. there is no counter besides range (which she tumbles in/out of) or hard CC. since targeted abilities have been steadily declining, it makes vayne a much more prevalent pick.

Not an Ahri main, just someone who's played her since her release x3 (I'm actually a Shaco main)

I just wanted to clear up the clarity issues people who haven't been familiar with her in the long run have, as Riot isn't sure what they're doing with her kit.

Back during DFG times and Assassin meta, Ahri players did tons of damage more but were always worried that the enemies might pick Talon.

By the way, Talon is still an Ahri hard counter. Galio is still strong against her (Galio was one of the few tanks that was strong during assassin meta) Swain still outsustains her and punishes her hard for trying to get close enough to point-blank combo, Leblanc and Annie are still too bursty for our foxy.

^These champs have been known to be strong in mid against Ahri for ages and is something that most long time players are familiar with. Tragically enough, Swain, Talon, Galio, and Leblanc as of recent are all unpopular even though they're all still extremely strong.

Once Leblanc stopped being popular after she got some slight nerfs to her damage and her broken silence removed, which removed one of Ahri player's biggest worries as they'd only have to ban Annie (Which a lot of people like to ban even if not playing Ahri)

Currently, Annie is the most played Ahri counter with a pick rate of 9% Leblanc has 7% Galio has under 1% Talon has 3% and Swain almost 2%

These low pick rates are the reason why Ahri seems so strong without counterplay in general, because her counters have very low pick rates which has caused her pick rate to inflate further.

Though the refocusing of her kit is needed, people also need to be aware that champions that counter Ahri do exist.

Why is it that whenever someone says "X champ seems statistically OP", defenders always go "Well these are their counters hurrr" when that's usually not the point of the discussion?

Ahri's problem is pretty simple to me - she's too safe. Her biggest weakness wasn't talon or Leblanc, is was her zero mobility pre-6 and when ult is down.

I still wanna know what Riot was smoking when they decided to give Ahri a buff that negated her biggest and most exploitable weakness.

You mean how she was ACTUALLY COMPENSATED unlike other mages who lost DFG? Her net changes have since 5.2 have been: Q mana cost up, Q MS boost, a _NERF_ to her W range, higher base damage and ap scaling on Charm (and losing the damage amp on it), and a _NERF_ to her ult target acquisition range. Oh, and a passive sustain nerf.
the Q movement speed? You do understand that everything Riot gave her after the DFG removal was reverted right? Everything in her kit was nerfed other than receiving the Q movement speed.

That Q movement speed is everything she needs to be safe though. An ahri could win unfavorable lanes by Qing and running back. I've played Talon and leblanc against an ahri and while they are strong against her, the lane is in no way easy due to the movement speed that comes with the Q. If she feels that I'm going to jump on her with lb? just a simple Q to get out of range. Only with talon can the lane be a bit easier, and even then, a good ahri will save her charm until I E to her so that she can escape my range with her Q ms. The slow from Rake is nowhere near enough to catch up, if there's even time to cast it before she's out of range

Edit: I also forgot to mention the fact that she has a total of 3 dashes in her ult, all of which are capable of dashing over walls

Alright, I know for certain that you are playing the matchups wrong. If she is Q-ing then running back you are able to zone her. Her Q costs a lot of mana so she will run out of it and eventually have 0 Kill pressure. Try and keep her below 40% mana, I believe that this is the minimum amount required for a full combo. The reason Leblanc and Talon have favorable matchups in those lanes is because they have minimal skillshots and are mostly targeted abilities with a lot of burst damage and mobility. Ultimately targeted abilities counter Ahri at all stages of the game because of how squishy she is. 

Ahri is completely skillshots while talon and leblanc are all targeted. The way to win lane is just to zone her and not make mistakes, such as being ganked because you are over extended or not standing behind minions. Sure an Ahri who plays correctly and wards their lane can never be ganked, but that goes for literally every single other champion in the game.

An Ahri match up is completely skill based, which means the more skilled player will always come out ahead. Need I mention how easy it is to zone her? I can go into a game as a 3rd time swain against an Ahri main and come out of the laning phase with 7 kills and 0 deaths by simply dodging her skillshots. If you are hit by a skillshot in lane it is completely your fault and not the champion being "OP." Her charm is telegraphed and has such a small hit box to the point where even if you are late on the reaction you should still be able to dodge it. Her Q is an easy side step, and even if you are hit by one proc you can easily dodge the return.

If the Ahri is running up, throwing Q-s and running away she isn't winning lane. Unless you suck at farming, you will come out of that lane ahead. If she makes a mistake like staying near the wave or missing her charm, you jump on her regardless, targeted abilities don't miss. Also calling mia is an important way to win lane, Ahri generally has a hard time winning lane and tends to roam to compensate for it.

Talon still is strong against Ahri, and still possesses the damage needed to burst her down without the silence. Ahri's charm and Q are not as dangerous for an experienced Talon as you may think, as they're both pretty easy to dodge if you're familiar with her ranges.

If he plays like someone who knows what they're doing, he can dodge poke and CS safely while punishing any attempts to dive him. (Not tower dive, just laning defensively for a little bit then she get's out scaled unless he does something stupid)

Many Ahri players (Including me) often fall for the old Talon leap bait where he act's like he's going to leap to you, but doesn't immediately which wastes a combo on the air. It's also extremely easy to fall for it, which is a problem which even plagues Plat/Dia players.

Leblanc has more mobility and her chains, which is an advantage that is underestimated. One single chain can force Ahri to either blow her ult/flash, or die. If Ahri doesn't get out of the chain tether range fast, that's often a death if it snares her.

Do note that an Ahri main will always beat someone who's new to Talon, although he's a counter he's not a Rammus press W to counter ADC style counter. On an even skill floor, Talon will hold the advantage and Ahri will have to be wary.

People that ahri is weak against are point click people and slippery targets
Swain, zed, lb (debatable since ahri can stop lb's w but lb's passive can take damage from w and r and out trades the fox), Annie, talon, yasuo (wall blocks everything but if you bait out wall with w and q then kite and do combo after stalling you can win, and yasuo is squishy), Galio, there's more but I can't really think of them at the moment. Anyways she has lots of counter play and you can technically avoid most of her damage. I think she is good right now because even after her passive nerfs, at around 40% CDR her ult has a cd of 47 seconds or so (not going to check but it's roughly around there), it's just that pre 6 and when ult isn't up, she is dead meat if caught.
That's just my opinion though, I only main ahri mid after all sorry if it isn't true

i always loop around minion when i fight her so I'm not charmed

Vayne's ult also gives her a lot of AD, further solidifying the only attack speed builds.

And now stats(sorry if I miss something, it's easy to miss small details) (I didn't count morde)
Vayne has the 2nd highest AD scale of any ADC (behind draven) and the 2nd highest level 18 AD of any ADC.
Vayne has the highest AS scale of any champ in the game and the highest level 18 AS.  She also has the 4th base attack speed of any adc, meaning she gets a lot of attack speed when she builds it.

What this ultimately means, when combined with her silver bolts, is that vayne is heavily rewarded for building attack speed.  This is why she's still a threat if she doesn't both building IE.

> so congrats you're forced to fight a carry with a stun! and she has lifesteal/stun/max %health true damage! and because all the AD items are pretty even across the board, it doesn't really matter how much raw AD she lacks because her AS/Crit make up for it to even out. with other ADC's and vayne JUST SO HAPPENS, to have utility as an ADC.

Her Ults makes up for her less AD, thats why you will see her rush BOTRK and such instead of a IE. Another thing you can add to your sentence.

(If you guys are wondering how much here it is:  30 / 50 / 70 AD).

I think with consistent nerfs to most other ADCs and indirect/direct buffs to BoRK, Vayne has slowly _tumbled_ to being a top pick ADC. It might be that Vayne has always been overpowered yet people haven't in large realized it until not that long ago, but it might just be because most ADCs are so weak right now. There's a lot of ways to look at the entire ADC role in general just by looking at Vayne. Sure by all means Vayne is more than likely stronger than she should be, but what about all other ADCs?

Right now most ADCs aren't that strong, not necessarily in comparison to each other but in comparison to other roles. They NEED their team by their side all game long regardless of how fed they are. If you don't position perfectly, know how to build perfectly, and have a really strong team behind you at all times including a really good Support, you're going to be so ineffective since nearly any Mid, Top, and now Jungler can instakill you with almost nothing you can do about it. There's no "oops i messed up" button like a lot of Mid or Top laners have. Mobility, CC, sustain, and the few ADCs that actually do have one of these components are the only ones ever played in the LCS. If you mess up, you die. Even then your self peel tools rarely guarantee your survival.

I don't think just saying nerf Vayne and forget she ever was an extremely powerful pick is a good idea (not saying you said that either, but most people seemingly are) and instead using her to help look at the Marksmen role in general would be better. Using her to model what a strong or overpowered ADC looks like in comparison to the rest.

The thing with Vayne is that she's immune to the woes of ADC because she works so much differently.

 Most ADC's need their team to protect and can't do anything alone, but are meant to make up for it with what they provide for the team, such as wave clear, team fighting damage, and sieging. Vayne is the exact opposite. She prefers to fight on her own and can protect herself, but lacks the wave, team fighting (her team fighting is actually pretty weak unless she's nearly full build or fed) and doesn't take towers very quickly. The weakpoint of many ADC's is the delay it takes to be relevant. The need the expensive, hard to build (fuck you bf sword), then the need attack speed, then they need armor pen, and now they can dish out damage before getting jumped on by everyone in the game. Vayne can just get bortk and be K, especially after the item got buffed (which is around the time all the Vayne hate starting rolling in). 

Vayne has less hard counters since her hard counters aren't very meta anymore. Graves and Lucian have fallen out of popularity. Caitlyn is ok but she can get duels by Vayne after level 6 if she wasn't aggressive enough. Champions with good zoning a la Azir and Victor seem to be getting less play. Cassiopia could probably zone out Vayne as well but I just recently saw someone saying she was in a weak spot right now. Brand might be able to get the job done but I've barely seen him. You can still pick Corki and rek her for a good bit but I barely see him in solo que.

Her numbers are a little bit off, yes. I agree with that, they could use some tweaking. But not the large-scale nerfs people have been asking for, not to mention she got a big impact on sustain due to this patch's nerf.

The reason why Ahri is too strong vs Non-counters, is because Riot won't make up their minds on how she is to be played. She was designed as a high mobility high damage caster assassin with some heals for utility, however Riot isn't emphasizing any one facet of her kit.

If they either went all the way with mobile assassin caster or sustained kite mage, she'd be very well balanced. But currently, Riot has her in a position where she has a bit of both which has made her strong against all non-counters.

So in recap: She's currently in a bit of a mess. When she's not against a counter, she's overall a very safe and good pick no matter the enemy team comp. But when countered, she's in a very dangerous place.

What Ahri needs most is not a nerf, but balancing her kit towards either being a sustained kite mage by lowering ability costs and damage or  increasing damage and costs by making her the high mobility cast based assassin she was designed to be.

If her kit was refocused instead of nerfed, the majority of the complaints would be gone. She'd excel at one field, while being decent at the rest. Instead of the current jack of all trades.

Most of it was in a joking manner, but Ahri mains were notorious around here for down voting anything that hinted at a slight nerf. That's why I'm glad people are starting to have a more honest conversation about her. Nobody is QQing about her, and trust me I wouldn't be trying to climb without learning about other champions. The fact of the matter is that Ahri has been at the top of the pack for so long now, and she could use some balancing because she is way too good right now. By toxic I meant that Ahri herself is toxic in her current state because of how reliable and safe she is when she's an assassin.

Nobody is saying gut her. However she's been a God tier pick for a lot longer than most champions, so you shouldn't be QQing that people are starting to ask for some changes concerning her. OP was talking about how she's not far behind Vayne in the win and pick rate, but we were never aloud to discuss that until very recently.

No I'm not QQ-ing, I'm just slightly annoyed that people are asking to gut her. I have seen a lot of posts asking to gut her and make her unviable for being "anti fun" when in reality people refuse to acknowledge her weaknesses. The joke may have gone over my head in the post TBH, sry if anyone got the wrong impression. I think a good nerf for her is to lower her ult's damage by making it do less damage to the same target, like how her W works. In my opinion the Q ms is necessary because it compensates for the cast time so kiting is safer. First things first...I'm not really an OP caller about any champ, especially when there are a million factors involved in League of Legends most obviously skill level. I am also not an ahri main but have enjoyed playing her often since lvl20 which was a long time ago

So, at the moment Ahri is indeed a very safe pick with decent damage numbers and good kiting ability. However I'd be very hesitant to make an serious changes to her as a champ because her playstyle isn't toxic. With all her skillshots counterplay can oftentimes be as simple as dodging well.
- A simple example of this is Ahri vs. Leblanc (which is btw my favorite lane matchup of all time) where Leblanc's damage is way more consistent so it's all a mindgame of the Ahri player learning her opponent's patterns and predicting the dash forward with a charm. If Leblanc is good at dodging and being unpredictable Ahri loses. Now it won't always be that cut and dry but the same principle applies to any Ahri lane. It's a complicated mind game which I feel makes the game more fun for either side

So Ahri is a bit strong in this meta, it's interesting because with very few to no changes to her over time Ahri's viability has always fluctuated on the edge up and down. Which in my opinion is the mark of a well made champion because it's pretty low maintenance. It's also kind of a delicate balance, do too much and Ahri might just end up broken.

TLDR: Ahri is currently on the strong side of things but not so far out of line she needs to be beaten back, maybe neatly trimmed by a careful gardener

Ahri is on the strong side of things because tanks aren't there to eat her charms for their team. Squishy devourer Jg's are the meta and that's where Ahri thrives, outplaying, punishing mistakes, and squishy targets that she can kite and burst down. Then again, most other assassins do more damage than her and would probably thrive more than her.
